tools.one_line_profile: Rust library for parsing VCF files
tools.detailed_description: A Rust implementation of a VCF parser, providing efficient and type-safe methods for reading and processing Variant Call Format files in Rust applications.

tools.name: vcfimp
tools.one_line_profile: Strict VCF parser library for Scala
tools.detailed_description: A Scala library for parsing Variant Call Format (VCF) files with strict adherence to the format specification, ensuring data integrity during processing.

tools.name: iobio.viz
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for visualizing streaming genomic data
tools.detailed_description: A visualization library tailored for streaming genomic data, providing components for charting and displaying real-time analysis results in web applications.

tools.name: LanGen_pipeline_version2
tools.one_line_profile: R scripts pipeline for Landscape Genomics Analyses
tools.detailed_description: A collection of R scripts forming a pipeline for landscape genomics analysis, facilitating the study of genetic variation in the context of environmental landscapes.

tools.name: clinical-filter
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for filtering trio-based genetic variants for clinical review
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to filter genetic variants from VCF files in a clinical context, specifically for trio analysis (parents and child), to identify potential disease-causing mutations for review.

tools.name: alignstats
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for computing comprehensive alignment and coverage statistics
tools.detailed_description: A C-based utility that generates detailed statistics on alignment quality, whole-genome coverage, and capture coverage from BAM/CRAM files, aiding in the quality assessment of sequencing experiments.

tools.name: needLR
tools.one_line_profile: Structural variant filtering and prioritization for long-read data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for filtering and prioritizing structural variants detected in long-read sequencing data, helping to reduce false positives and identify high-confidence variants.

tools.name: TaxTriage
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow workflow for microbial identification in metagenomic data
tools.detailed_description: A flexible Nextflow workflow designed to identify and classify microbial organisms from short- or long-read metagenomic NGS data, supporting various mNGS use cases.

tools.name: smsk_popoolation
tools.one_line_profile: Snakemake pipeline for Popoolation and Popoolation2
tools.detailed_description: A Snakemake workflow that automates the execution of Popoolation and Popoolation2 tools, streamlining population genetics analysis from pooled sequencing data.

tools.name: ALPACA
tools.one_line_profile: Algebraic variant caller for NGS data with sample-based filtering
tools.detailed_description: A genomic variant caller for single nucleotide variants and small indels that employs an algebraic approach to incorporate sample-based filtering directly into the calling process, allowing for intuitive False Discovery Rate (FDR) control.

tools.name: HilbertCurve
tools.one_line_profile: R package for visualizing genomic data using Hilbert curves
tools.detailed_description: A tool that provides an implementation of Hilbert curves for visualizing high-dimensional genomic data in a 2D space, allowing for the effective representation of long-range genomic interactions and other spatial features.

tools.name: ipyigv
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for the igv.js genome browser
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that enables the embedding of the Integrative Genomics Viewer (igv.js) directly into Jupyter notebooks, facilitating interactive genomic data visualization and analysis within Python workflows.

tools.name: MetaProFi
tools.one_line_profile: Bloom filter-based tool for sequence data querying
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for storing and querying sequence data using Bloom filters to accurately identify functionally relevant genetic variants, developed by the Kalinina Lab.

tools.name: igv_utils
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for controlling IGV and igv.js
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utilities for working with the Integrative Genomics Viewer (IGV), including functionality for opening files remotely in desktop IGV or web viewers and creating screenshots.

tools.name: pyfaidx
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Pythonic random access to FASTA subsequences
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides efficient, pythonic random access to subsequences within FASTA files, handling indexing and memory management automatically.

tools.name: vcf-go
tools.one_line_profile: Variant Call Format (VCF) parser library for Go
tools.detailed_description: A library written in Go for parsing Variant Call Format (VCF) files, enabling the development of high-performance bioinformatics tools in the Go programming language.

tools.name: Picard-ICA
tools.one_line_profile: Preconditioned ICA for Real Data
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Preconditioned Independent Component Analysis (ICA) algorithm, designed for efficient signal processing and source separation in scientific data (e.g., EEG/MEG).

tools.name: GeneticsMakie.jl
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance genetics data visualization in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package leveraging Makie.jl for high-performance, interactive visualization of genetics and genomics data, including GWAS results and linkage disequilibrium plots.

tools.name: vcf_parser
tools.one_line_profile: Simple VCF parser based on PyVCF
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library for parsing Variant Call Format (VCF) files, designed as a simpler alternative or wrapper around PyVCF for extracting variant information.

tools.name: gTrack
tools.one_line_profile: R package for multi-track genomic data visualization
tools.detailed_description: An R package for visualizing complex 1D and 2D genomic data within the GenomicRanges framework, supporting multi-track layouts for structural variants and copy number profiles.

tools.name: Iliad
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Snakemake workflows for genomic data processing
tools.detailed_description: A suite of automated Snakemake workflows designed to process genomic data for various downstream applications, facilitating reproducible analysis pipelines.

tools.name: nf-core/hgtseq
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to investigate horizontal gene transfer from NGS data
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline developed under nf-core standards for detecting and investigating horizontal gene transfer events using Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) data.

tools.name: nf-core/seqinspector
tools.one_line_profile: Dedicated QC pipeline for sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for comprehensive quality control of sequencing data, capable of running multiple QC tools and generating aggregated MultiQC reports, suitable for core facilities.

tools.name: NGLess
tools.one_line_profile: Domain-specific language for NGS data processing
tools.detailed_description: NGLess is a domain-specific language and framework designed to simplify Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) data processing, ensuring reproducibility and ease of use for common bioinformatics tasks.

tools.name: rna-seq-diff-exprn
tools.one_line_profile: RNA-Seq differential expression analysis pipeline integrating multiple standard tools
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline for RNA-Sequencing data analysis that performs genome coverage calculation, differential expression analysis, structural variant detection, and differential exon usage analysis using tools like DESeq, NOISeq, and DEXSeq.

tools.name: JSorolla
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for biological and genomic data visualization
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library developed by OpenCB for visualizing biological and genomic data, providing components for web-based genomic tools.

tools.name: hic_qc
tools.one_line_profile: Simple quality control script for Hi-C data
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool for performing quality control on Hi-C sequencing data, developed by Phase Genomics.

tools.name: faster-ica
tools.one_line_profile: Library for maximum likelihood Independent Component Analysis (ICA) algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing several maximum likelihood ICA algorithms, including the Picard algorithm, used for signal processing and source separation in scientific data.

tools.name: radseq
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for parsing and analyzing RAD-seq data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts designed for the processing, parsing, and analysis of Restriction site Associated DNA sequencing (RAD-seq) data.

tools.name: pysam
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for reading and manipulating genomics data (SAM/BAM/VCF)
tools.detailed_description: A widely used Python library that wraps HTSlib, enabling efficient reading, manipulating, and writing of genomic data formats including SAM, BAM, CRAM, VCF, and BCF.

tools.name: VisualQC
tools.one_line_profile: Assistive tool for quality control of neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A software tool designed to ease the quality control workflow of neuroimaging data, providing visualization and assessment capabilities.

tools.name: gd3
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for visualizing genomics data with D3
tools.detailed_description: A library for creating interactive genomic data visualizations using D3.js, developed by the Raphael research group.

tools.name: bioruby-samtools
tools.one_line_profile: Ruby bindings for samtools via FFI
tools.detailed_description: A BioRuby plugin that provides bindings to the samtools library, allowing manipulation of SAM/BAM files within Ruby applications.

tools.name: PyPore
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for quality control and processing of nanopore sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for fast and accurate quality control, format conversion, and alignment of nanopore sequencing data.

tools.name: BCFtools
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for variant calling and manipulating VCF/BCF files
tools.detailed_description: A set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart (BCF). It is a core tool for variant calling, filtering, and analysis.

tools.name: samtools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for manipulating next-generation sequencing data (SAM/BAM/CRAM)
tools.detailed_description: A suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data. It provides functionality for reading, writing, editing, indexing, and viewing data in SAM, BAM, and CRAM formats.

tools.name: Estimation-algorithms
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB functions for estimation algorithms (EKF, UKF, Particle Filter)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB implementations for various estimation algorithms including Extended Kalman Filter, Unscented Kalman Filter, and Particle Filter, used in scientific modeling and control.

tools.name: SeqAn3
tools.one_line_profile: Modern C++ library for efficient sequence analysis
tools.detailed_description: The third version of the SeqAn library, providing efficient, generic, and reusable C++ algorithms and data structures for the analysis of biological sequences.

tools.name: vcztools
tools.one_line_profile: Partial reimplementation of bcftools for VCF Zarr
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by the sgkit project to manipulate VCF data stored in Zarr format, aiming to provide bcftools-like functionality for cloud-native genomics.

tools.name: chip-seq_preprocess
tools.one_line_profile: Preprocessing pipeline for ChIP-seq data
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for processing ChIP-seq data, covering alignment, quality control, and visualization steps, developed by the Shen Lab at Mount Sinai.

tools.name: ngsplot
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for NGS data mining
tools.detailed_description: A tool for quick mining and visualization of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data by integrating genomic databases, allowing for the generation of enrichment plots and heatmaps.

tools.name: SeqKit
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform toolkit for FASTA/Q file manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive and ultrafast toolkit for processing FASTA and FASTQ files, providing functions for statistics, formatting, filtering, and conversion.

tools.name: picardmetrics
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper to run Picard metrics and collate results
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based utility that runs various Picard tools on BAM files to generate QC metrics and collates them into a single summary file.

tools.name: QC3
tools.one_line_profile: Quality control tool for DNA sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: A quality control tool designed for DNA sequencing data, handling raw data, alignment, and variant calling stages.

tools.name: IGV-snapshot-automator
tools.one_line_profile: Automation tool for generating genomic data snapshots using IGV
tools.detailed_description: A Python script that automates the creation of batch scripts for the Integrative Genomics Viewer (IGV) to take snapshots of specific genomic regions, facilitating visual inspection of variants.

tools.name: Alfred
tools.one_line_profile: BAM statistics, feature counting, and annotation tool
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance C++ tool for quality control, feature counting, and annotation of BAM alignment files, supporting various sequencing protocols.

tools.name: bio-vcf
tools.one_line_profile: DSL-based VCF parser and filter
tools.detailed_description: A smart VCF parser that provides a Domain Specific Language (DSL) for filtering, parsing, and rewriting VCF files, implemented in Ruby.

tools.name: vcflib
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library and command-line tools for VCF manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive C++ library and suite of command-line tools for parsing, manipulating, and filtering VCF files, serving as a foundational toolkit for variant analysis.

tools.name: VCFtools
tools.one_line_profile: Program package for working with VCF files
tools.detailed_description: A classic suite of tools written in Perl and C++ for working with VCF files, providing validation, merging, comparing, and calculating statistics for genomic variants.

tools.name: cramino
tools.one_line_profile: Fast quality evaluation tool for BAM/CRAM files
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Rust-based tool for generating quality metrics and statistics for BAM and CRAM files, specifically optimized for long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: biobear
tools.one_line_profile: Bioinformatics file I/O using Arrow and Polars
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables reading and working with bioinformatics file formats (FASTA, FASTQ, VCF, BAM, GFF) using Apache Arrow, Polars, and DuckDB for high-performance data analysis.

tools.name: OGU
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for organelle genomic data utilization
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox designed for processing and analyzing organelle genomic data, facilitating specific genomic workflows.

tools.name: Aldy
tools.one_line_profile: Allelic decomposition and exact genotyping for highly polymorphic genes
tools.detailed_description: Aldy is a tool for allelic decomposition and exact genotyping of highly polymorphic and structurally variant genes, such as CYP2D6, using sequencing data.

tools.name: Long Ranger
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis pipeline for 10x Genomics Linked-Read data
tools.detailed_description: Long Ranger is a set of analysis pipelines that processes 10x Genomics Linked-Read data to align reads, call variants, phase haplotypes, and detect structural variants.

tools.name: Vartrix
tools.one_line_profile: Single-cell genotyping tool for 10x Genomics data
tools.detailed_description: Vartrix is a tool for extracting single-cell genotype information from 10x Genomics single-cell data, enabling the evaluation of variants in individual cells.

tools.name: yhaplo
tools.one_line_profile: Y-chromosome haplogroup identification tool
tools.detailed_description: yhaplo identifies Y-chromosome haplogroups in arbitrarily large samples of sequenced or genotyped men, traversing the Y-chromosome phylogenetic tree.

tools.name: EnsembleVariantCallingPipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble pipeline for SNV and INDEL variant calling
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline that performs SNV and INDEL variant calling using an ensemble of callers (Mutect2, Strelka2, Varscan2, MuSE) to improve accuracy.

tools.name: Crossbow
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud-based variant calling from sequence reads
tools.detailed_description: Crossbow is a cloud-computing software tool for performing alignment and variant calling on large-scale sequencing data.

tools.name: BCFTools (Bruker)
tools.one_line_profile: Unpacker for Bruker Esprit BCF data files
tools.detailed_description: A tool to unpack and process Bruker Esprit (.bcf) data files used in electron microscopy and spectroscopy (EDX/EBSD). Note: Distinct from the bioinformatics bcftools.

tools.name: Control-FREEC
tools.one_line_profile: Copy number and genotype annotation tool
tools.detailed_description: Control-FREEC is a tool for copy number variation (CNV) detection and genotype annotation using whole genome and whole exome sequencing data.

tools.name: AntCaller
tools.one_line_profile: SNP calling and genotyping for damaged DNA
tools.detailed_description: AntCaller is a tool designed for SNP calling and genotyping specifically in damaged DNA samples, such as ancient DNA.

tools.name: Opossum
tools.one_line_profile: RNA-seq read pre-processing for variant calling
tools.detailed_description: Opossum is a tool to pre-process RNA-seq reads prior to variant calling, helping to remove noise and improve calling accuracy.

tools.name: PopGenTools
tools.one_line_profile: SNP/Genotype calling and population genetics analysis
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for SNP and genotype calling based on ANGSD, along with downstream population genetics analyses.

tools.name: CalliNGS-NF
tools.one_line_profile: GATK RNA-Seq Variant Calling Workflow
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline implementing the GATK Best Practices for RNA-Seq variant calling.

tools.name: LoFreq Star
tools.one_line_profile: Sensitive variant calling from sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: LoFreq is a fast and sensitive variant-caller for inferring SNVs and indels from next-generation sequencing data, designed to call low-frequency variants.

tools.name: VEF
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble-based filter for VCF files
tools.detailed_description: Variant Ensemble Filter (VEF) is a tool that filters VCF files using an ensemble approach to improve variant quality.

tools.name: SNVCallingWorkflow
tools.one_line_profile: DKFZ SNV-Calling Workflow
tools.detailed_description: The standard SNV-calling workflow used by DKFZ-ODCF for processing cancer genomics data.

tools.name: Graphtyper
tools.one_line_profile: Population-scale genotyping using pangenome graphs
tools.detailed_description: Graphtyper is a tool for population-scale genotyping that utilizes pangenome graphs to improve alignment and variant calling accuracy.

tools.name: GEFormer
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for genotype-environment interaction prediction
tools.detailed_description: GEFormer is a deep learning-based genome-wide prediction model designed to predict phenotypes (e.g., maize) by jointly analyzing genotype and environment interactions.

tools.name: EpiDiverse SNP
tools.one_line_profile: Bisulfite SNP-Calling and Methylation Clustering Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for calling SNPs from bisulfite sequencing data and performing methylation clustering.

tools.name: MindTheGap
tools.one_line_profile: Insertion variant caller and local assembler
tools.detailed_description: MindTheGap is a structural variant caller dedicated to detecting insertion variants from short read sequencing data, also capable of local assembly.

tools.name: snp_calling_bcftools_slurm
tools.one_line_profile: SLURM-based bcftools SNP calling pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for performing SNP calling using bcftools, optimized for execution on SLURM-managed clusters.

tools.name: DeNovoCNN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for de novo variant calling
tools.detailed_description: DeNovoCNN uses deep convolutional neural networks to call de novo variants from next-generation sequencing data.

tools.name: GenomicsDB
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance storage for genomic variants
tools.detailed_description: GenomicsDB is a high-performance data storage system designed for importing, querying, and transforming genomic variant data, often used in GATK workflows.

tools.name: Clair
tools.one_line_profile: Deep neural network for germline variant calling
tools.detailed_description: Clair is a deep neural network-based variant caller that operates on pileup data to detect germline variants.

tools.name: Clair-Mosaic
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for mosaic small variant calling
tools.detailed_description: Clair-Mosaic is a deep learning-based tool specifically designed for calling mosaic small variants from long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: Clair3
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance long-read variant calling
tools.detailed_description: Clair3 combines pileup and full-alignment models using deep learning to achieve high performance in long-read variant calling.

tools.name: Clair3-MP
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-platform variant calling
tools.detailed_description: Clair3-MP is an extension of Clair3 designed for variant calling using sequencing data from multiple platforms.

tools.name: Clair3-Nova
tools.one_line_profile: De novo variant calling in trios using long reads
tools.detailed_description: Clair3-Nova is a tool for de novo variant calling in trio samples using Nanopore long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: Clair3-RNA
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read small variant caller for RNA-seq
tools.detailed_description: Clair3-RNA is a deep learning-based small variant caller optimized for long-read RNA sequencing data.

tools.name: Clair3-Trio
tools.one_line_profile: Trio variant calling using Nanopore long-reads
tools.detailed_description: Clair3-Trio is a variant calling tool that leverages trio information and Nanopore long-reads to improve accuracy.

tools.name: ClairS
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read somatic small variant calling
tools.detailed_description: ClairS is a deep learning method designed for somatic small variant calling using long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: ClairS-TO
tools.one_line_profile: Tumor-only somatic variant calling
tools.detailed_description: ClairS-TO is a deep learning method for calling somatic variants in tumor-only samples (without matched normal).

tools.name: alignment-nf
tools.one_line_profile: WES/WGS alignment pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for Whole Exome and Whole Genome Sequencing alignment, facilitating reproducible data processing.

tools.name: gatk4-GenotypeGVCFs-nf
tools.one_line_profile: Joint calling workflow for gVCFs
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for joint calling of gVCF files using GATK4 GenotypeGVCFs, following GATK Best Practices.

tools.name: gatk4-HaplotypeCaller-nf
tools.one_line_profile: GATK4 HaplotypeCaller workflow
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for running GATK4 HaplotypeCaller in gVCF mode, serving as the first step for cohort joint genotyping.

tools.name: Cyrius
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate CYP2D6 genotyping using whole-genome sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: Cyrius is a software tool designed to accurately genotype the complex CYP2D6 gene using whole-genome sequencing (WGS) data. It handles the high homology between CYP2D6 and its pseudogenes, providing star-allele calling which is critical for pharmacogenomics.

tools.name: Pisces
tools.one_line_profile: Somatic and germline variant caller for amplicon sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: Pisces is a variant caller optimized for amplicon sequencing data, capable of detecting both somatic and germline small variants. It is particularly recommended for tumor-only workflows and includes modules for variant calling, filtering, and output generation.

tools.name: Canvas
tools.one_line_profile: Copy number variant (CNV) calling from DNA sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: Canvas is a tool for calling copy number variants (CNVs) from germline and somatic DNA sequencing data. It supports various workflows including whole-genome sequencing (WGS), whole-exome sequencing (WES), and targeted panels.

tools.name: Paragraph
tools.one_line_profile: Graph realignment tools for accurate structural variant genotyping
tools.detailed_description: Paragraph is a suite of graph-based realignment tools designed to accurately genotype structural variants (SVs) and indels using short-read sequencing data. It constructs sequence graphs to represent haplotypes and aligns reads to these graphs to improve genotyping accuracy.

tools.name: Strelka2
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and accurate germline and somatic small variant caller
tools.detailed_description: Strelka2 is a fast and accurate small variant caller optimized for germline and somatic analysis of whole genome and exome sequencing data. It employs a mixture model to estimate variant probabilities and is widely used in production pipelines.

tools.name: Varscan2 Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for running Varscan2 copy number variation calling
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains shell scripts to facilitate the execution of Varscan2 for copy number variation (CNV) calling on tumor and normal BAM files. It serves as a workflow wrapper for the Varscan2 tool.

tools.name: EVG
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble pipeline for graph-based variant genotyping
tools.detailed_description: EVG (Ensemble Variant Genotyping) is a pipeline that integrates graph-based methods for accurate variant genotyping, particularly effective with lower depth short reads. It aims to improve genotyping performance by combining multiple approaches.

tools.name: genotype_plot
tools.one_line_profile: Visualisation of genotypes from VCF files
tools.detailed_description: genotype_plot is an R package providing functions to visualize genotypes directly from VCF files. It allows researchers to create graphical representations of genotype calls across samples to assess quality and distribution.

tools.name: KalmanFilter.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Kalman Filter implementations in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing various Kalman Filters including KF, UKF, and AUKF. While primarily a general signal processing tool, it is a valid scientific computing library for estimation tasks.

tools.name: KalmanFilters.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Various Kalman Filter implementations in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing implementations of Kalman Filters (KF, UKF, AUKF) and their square root variants. It is a general-purpose scientific tool for state estimation.

tools.name: GATK-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Shell script implementation of the GATK variant calling pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A shell script that implements the standard GATK pipeline for variant calling. It automates the steps from alignment processing to variant calling, facilitating reproducible analysis.

tools.name: Seave
tools.one_line_profile: Web platform for filtering and annotating genetic variants
tools.detailed_description: Seave is a web-based platform designed for the filtering, annotation, and analysis of genomic variants. It supports various inheritance patterns and integrates with disease databases to aid in pathogenicity prediction and clinical reporting.

tools.name: Optimized_GATK4_pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Optimized GATK4 pipeline for variant calling and processing
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based pipeline for processing FASTQ/BAM files and performing variant calling, filtering, and annotation using GATK4. It aims to streamline the standard GATK best practices workflow.

tools.name: Severus
tools.one_line_profile: Somatic structural variant calling using long reads
tools.detailed_description: Severus is a bioinformatics tool developed for detecting somatic structural variants (SVs) in cancer genomes using long-read sequencing data. It leverages the length of reads to resolve complex rearrangements.

tools.name: IMSindel
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate intermediate-size indel detection tool
tools.detailed_description: IMSindel is a tool for detecting intermediate-size insertions and deletions (indels) that are often missed by standard aligners. It incorporates de novo assembly and gapped global-local alignment with split read analysis to improve detection accuracy.

tools.name: GEMSCAN
tools.one_line_profile: Joint variant calling pipeline with GATK4, DeepVariant, and Strelka2
tools.detailed_description: GEMSCAN is a Snakemake-based pipeline for joint variant calling. It orchestrates multiple callers including GATK4 HaplotypeCaller, Google DeepVariant, and Strelka2 to provide comprehensive variant detection.

tools.name: VariantWorks
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning based variant calling toolkit
tools.detailed_description: VariantWorks is a framework to enable the development of deep learning-based genomic variant callers. It provides tools for encoding genomic data and training models, facilitating the application of AI to variant detection.

tools.name: Octopus v4
tools.one_line_profile: On-device language model for function calling and agentic AI
tools.detailed_description: Octopus v4 is a specialized language model designed for graph-based function calling and agent orchestration. While primarily an AI research tool, it represents a scientific artifact in the field of Large Language Models.

tools.name: snv-calling-nf
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow workflow for SNV calling using multiple callers
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow workflow designed for Single Nucleotide Variant (SNV) calling. It integrates GATK4/MuTect2, CaVEMan/Pindel, and Strelka2 to provide a robust consensus or comparative calling approach.

tools.name: Spark-GATK
tools.one_line_profile: Genomics analysis framework based on Apache Spark and ADAM
tools.detailed_description: Spark-GATK is a distributed genomics analysis framework that leverages Apache Spark and ADAM to accelerate GATK-based workflows. It is designed to handle large-scale genomic data processing efficiently.

tools.name: pbsv
tools.one_line_profile: PacBio structural variant (SV) calling and analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: pbsv is a suite of tools developed by Pacific Biosciences for calling and analyzing structural variants from PacBio long-read sequencing data. It is optimized for the error profile and read length of PacBio HiFi and CLR data.

tools.name: trgt
tools.one_line_profile: Tandem repeat genotyping and visualization from PacBio HiFi data
tools.detailed_description: trgt is a tool for genotyping and visualizing tandem repeats using PacBio HiFi sequencing data. It provides accurate sizing and methylation analysis of repeat expansions, which are critical for many genetic diseases.

tools.name: PathOS
tools.one_line_profile: Clinical application for filtering, analysing and reporting on NGS variants
tools.detailed_description: PathOS is a clinical-grade software application designed for the curation, filtering, analysis, and reporting of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) variants. It facilitates the translation of genomic data into clinical reports.

tools.name: bioluigi
tools.one_line_profile: Reusable Luigi tasks for bioinformatics pipelines
tools.detailed_description: bioluigi provides a collection of reusable tasks for the Luigi workflow engine, specifically tailored for bioinformatics pipelines. It simplifies the creation of complex, dependency-managed genomic analysis workflows.

tools.name: cue
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for SV calling and genotyping
tools.detailed_description: cue is a deep learning-based framework designed for the calling and genotyping of structural variants (SVs). It utilizes neural networks to learn features from sequencing data for improved SV detection.

tools.name: Mapping_SNP_Indel_calling

tools.detailed_description: A Perl-based pipeline implementing BWA and GATK for mapping and SNP/Indel calling. It is specifically configured for use with the IWGSC pseudo-chromosomal reference sequence, addressing specific needs in wheat genomics.

tools.name: arcasHLA
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and accurate in silico inference of HLA genotypes from RNA-seq
tools.detailed_description: arcasHLA is a computational tool for inferring HLA genotypes directly from RNA-seq data. It provides high-resolution genotyping of HLA class I and II genes, which is essential for immunogenomics research.

tools.name: GATK_pipeline_customized
tools.one_line_profile: Customized GATK pipeline for GBS/RAD/SLAF-seq SNP calling
tools.detailed_description: A customized GATK pipeline optimized for SNP calling from reduced representation sequencing data such as GBS, RAD-seq, and SLAF-seq. It is designed to run on High Performance Computing (HPC) environments.

tools.name: TIDDIT
tools.one_line_profile: Structural variant calling tool
tools.detailed_description: TIDDIT is a tool for the detection of structural variants (SVs) in whole genome sequencing data. It uses split-read and discordant pair analysis to identify various types of SVs, including large deletions and translocations.

tools.name: sentieon-dnaseq
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts and documentation for Sentieon DNAseq workflow
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides scripts and guidelines for running the Sentieon DNAseq pipeline, a high-performance implementation of the GATK best practices for variant calling. It facilitates the deployment of Sentieon's accelerated genomics tools.

tools.name: Variants2Neoantigen
tools.one_line_profile: Neoantigen calling pipeline from variant records
tools.detailed_description: Variants2Neoantigen is a pipeline that predicts neoantigens starting from variant record files (MAF). It automates the process of identifying potential immunogenic peptides arising from somatic mutations.

tools.name: ilus
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline generator for WGS/WES analysis using GATK and Sentieon
tools.detailed_description: ilus is a lightweight tool to generate variant calling pipelines for Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) and Whole Exome Sequencing (WES). It supports both GATK and Sentieon backends, simplifying the creation of analysis workflows.

tools.name: TeraStructure
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithm to fit Bayesian models of genetic variation in human populations on tera-sample-sized data sets
tools.detailed_description: TeraStructure is a new algorithm to fit Bayesian models of genetic variation in human populations on tera-sample-sized data sets (10^12 observed genotypes, i.e., 1M individuals at 1M SNPs). This package provides a scalable, multi-threaded C++ implementation that can be run on a single computer.

tools.name: seq2HLA

tools.detailed_description: In-silico method written in Python and R to determine HLA genotypes of a sample. seq2HLA takes standard RNA-Seq sequence reads in fastq format as input, uses a bowtie index comprising all HLA alleles and outputs the most likely HLA class I and class II genotypes.

tools.detailed_description: A web-based visualization tool designed to display modeled segments and raw read/allele counts from GATK Copy Number Variation (CNV) analysis results.

tools.name: tso_cnv
tools.one_line_profile: CNV detection for TruSightOne capture data
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool for detecting copy number variations (CNV) specifically in data generated using the TruSightOne capture panel.

tools.name: long-read-validation
tools.one_line_profile: Validation of BEDPE structural variations using long reads
tools.detailed_description: A tool for validating structural variation calls in BEDPE format using long-read sequencing data, helping to assess the quality of SV predictions.

tools.name: ampliCNV
tools.one_line_profile: CNV detection for amplicon-based WES data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for detecting copy number variations (CNV) in whole exome sequencing (WES) data obtained via amplicon-based enrichment technologies.

tools.name: dev-survivors
tools.one_line_profile: Reliable and interpretable survival analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to survival analysis, providing reliable and interpretable models for statistical analysis of time-to-event data.

tools.name: SV-plaudit
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for structural variant image curation
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to facilitate the manual curation and analysis of structural variant (SV) candidates by generating and managing visualization images.

tools.name: PopSV
tools.one_line_profile: Population-based detection of structural variation
tools.detailed_description: An R package for detecting structural variations (SVs) from high-throughput sequencing data using population-based methods to improve accuracy.

tools.name: GenomeSyn
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for constructing and visualizing genome synteny
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed for the construction and visualization of genome synteny, aiding in the study of genomic structural variations and comparative genomics.

tools.name: CNVfilteR
tools.one_line_profile: R package to remove false positive CNV calls using SNVs
tools.detailed_description: An R package that leverages single nucleotide variant (SNV) calls to identify and remove false positive copy number variation (CNV) calls from various tools.

tools.name: SVGene
tools.one_line_profile: SVG gene cluster visualization library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for generating SVG-based visualizations of gene clusters, useful for displaying genomic structures and variations.

tools.name: scSVA
tools.one_line_profile: Single-cell Scalable Visualization and Analytics
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the scalable visualization and analysis of single-cell data, potentially including structural variation analysis in single cells.

tools.name: freec2gistic
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from CONTROL-freec output to GISTIC2 format
tools.detailed_description: A workflow utility to convert copy number calling output from CONTROL-freec into the format required by GISTIC2 for recurrent CNV analysis.

tools.name: x11hts
tools.one_line_profile: X11 related utilities for HTS data visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of C++ utilities for visualizing High-Throughput Sequencing (HTS) data using the X11 window system.

tools.name: Aperture
tools.one_line_profile: Alignment-free detection of SVs and viral integrations in ctDNA
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based tool for the alignment-free detection of structural variations and viral integrations, specifically optimized for circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) analysis.

tools.name: CAISC
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of SNV and CNV for single-cell subclone detection
tools.detailed_description: A software tool to integrate copy number variation (CNV) and single nucleotide mutations (SNV) for genetic heterogeneity profiling and subclone detection using single-cell RNA sequencing data.

tools.name: MARS
tools.one_line_profile: Multiple Samples Alignment-based SV Calling and Refinement
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for structural variant (SV) calling and refinement by leveraging multiple sample alignments to improve detection accuracy.

tools.name: VolcanoSV
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read structural variant caller for diploid genomes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for accurate and robust structural variant calling in diploid genomes using single-molecule long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: CallSV
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read SV calling pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for calling structural variants (SVs) from long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: iPsychCNV
tools.one_line_profile: Copy number variation detection method for dried blood spots using intensity data
tools.detailed_description: iPsychCNV is an R package designed to detect Copy Number Variations (CNVs) from hybridization intensity data, specifically optimized for DNA extracted from dried blood spots (DBS). It addresses the noise and variability inherent in DBS samples.

tools.name: VACmap
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read aligner optimized for complex structural variation discovery
tools.detailed_description: VACmap is a genome alignment tool specifically designed to handle long reads (PacBio/Nanopore) with a focus on improving the detection of complex structural variations (SVs) by preserving alignment information in complex regions.

tools.name: nanopore-SV-analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for structural variant filtering and analysis of Nanopore WGS data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts and workflows for processing, filtering, and analyzing structural variants called from Nanopore human whole-genome sequencing data.

tools.name: colorSV
tools.one_line_profile: Somatic structural variant calling on matched tumor-normal co-assembly graphs
tools.detailed_description: colorSV is a tool for detecting somatic structural variations by analyzing colored de Bruijn graphs constructed from matched tumor-normal sequencing data, enabling precise identification of cancer-specific variants.

tools.name: knotAnnotSV
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization script for AnnotSV structural variant annotations
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool to convert AnnotSV output files into customizable HTML reports, facilitating the visualization and interpretation of annotated structural variants.

tools.name: CoNVaDING
tools.one_line_profile: Copy Number Variation Detection In Next-generation sequencing Gene panels
tools.detailed_description: CoNVaDING is designed for detecting small (single-exon) copy number variations (CNVs) in high-coverage next-generation sequencing (NGS) gene panel data, offering high sensitivity for clinical diagnostics.

tools.name: combiSV
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to combine structural variation calls from long-read sequencing
tools.detailed_description: combiSV integrates structural variation (SV) calls from multiple long-read callers (like Sniffles, PBSV) to create a superior, consensus SV call set, improving recall and precision.

tools.name: exomecnv
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow pipeline for calling exome CNVs
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline built with Nextflow for detecting Copy Number Variations (CNVs) from exome sequencing data, automating the analysis workflow.

tools.name: structural
tools.one_line_profile: Best-practice pipeline for SV, CNV, and RRE calling from short reads
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Nextflow pipeline for calling Structural Variants (SVs), Copy Number Variants (CNVs), and Repeat Region Expansions (RREs) from short-read DNA sequencing data, following best practices.

tools.name: V-SVA
tools.one_line_profile: R Shiny app for detecting hidden variation in scRNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: V-SVA is an interactive R Shiny application that performs Surrogate Variable Analysis (SVA) to detect and annotate hidden sources of variation (e.g., batch effects) in single-cell RNA-seq data.

tools.name: cnvPlotteR
tools.one_line_profile: Plotting functions for CNV data from CNV-Seq and Control-FREEC
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing advanced plotting functions to visualize Copy Number Variation (CNV) data generated by tools like CNV-Seq and Control-FREEC.

tools.name: svParser
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to explore and filter structural variant calls from Lumpy and Delly
tools.detailed_description: A Perl-based utility for parsing, filtering, and exploring structural variant (SV) calls in VCF format produced by callers like Lumpy and Delly.

tools.name: FindCSV
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read based method for detecting complex structural variations
tools.detailed_description: FindCSV is a computational method designed to detect complex structural variations (CSVs) using long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: exvar
tools.one_line_profile: R Package for Gene Expression and Genetic Variation Analysis
tools.detailed_description: exvar is an R package developed for the analysis and visualization of gene expression data alongside genetic variations, including SNPs, Indels, and CNVs.

tools.name: GSSplayground
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight web-based tool for visualizing genome segments and features
tools.detailed_description: GSSplayground is a single-file HTML tool for visualizing genome features, synteny, and read mappings (short/long reads). It supports interactive modification of features and visualization of alignments.

tools.name: HiNT
tools.one_line_profile: Hi-C for Copy Number Variation and Translocation detection
tools.detailed_description: HiNT is a computational method for detecting Copy Number Variations (CNVs) and Translocations using Hi-C interaction data, leveraging the spatial organization of the genome.

tools.name: NGMLR
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read mapper for structural variation detection
tools.detailed_description: NGMLR is a long-read mapper designed to align PacBio or Oxford Nanopore reads to a reference genome with a specific focus on accurately mapping reads that span structural variations.

tools.name: rCNV
tools.one_line_profile: R package for detecting copy number variants from SNP data
tools.detailed_description: rCNV is an R package designed to detect Copy Number Variants (CNVs) using data from Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs), facilitating genetic variation analysis.

tools.name: VisCap
tools.one_line_profile: Inference and visualization tool for germline copy number variants (CNVs)
tools.detailed_description: VisCap is a software program designed for clinical laboratories to infer and visualize germline copy number variants (CNVs) from targeted next-generation sequencing data. It aids in the analysis of targeted capture sequencing for detecting copy number changes.

tools.name: svgling
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for drawing linguistics trees to SVG
tools.detailed_description: svgling is a pure Python package for rendering linguistics tree diagrams (syntax trees) as SVG images. It is designed for use in Jupyter notebooks and supports integration with various linguistic libraries.

tools.name: reconCNV
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for CNV data from targeted capture sequencing
tools.detailed_description: reconCNV is a Python-based tool for visualizing Copy Number Variation (CNV) data derived from targeted capture-based sequencing. It helps researchers inspect and interpret CNV calls visually.

tools.name: iAnnotateSV
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit to annotate and visualize structural variants from NGS data
tools.detailed_description: iAnnotateSV is a Python library and command-line toolkit designed to annotate and visualize structural variants (SVs) detected from Next Generation DNA sequencing data. It provides detailed annotations to help interpret the functional impact of SVs.

tools.name: ProcaryaSV
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble structural variant calling pipeline for prokaryotic genomes
tools.detailed_description: ProcaryaSV is an ensemble structural variant calling pipeline driven by Snakemake. It integrates multiple SV and CNV callers to improve detection accuracy in prokaryotic genomes.

tools.name: samplot
tools.one_line_profile: Structural variant signal visualization for BAMs and CRAMs
tools.detailed_description: samplot is a command-line tool for plotting structural variant signals from many BAM and CRAM files. It creates images that display the read depth and alignment characteristics supporting SV calls, facilitating manual review and curation.

tools.name: blender-mantaflow
tools.one_line_profile: Mantaflow fluid simulation integration for Blender
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the integration of the Mantaflow fluid simulation framework into Blender. It enables advanced fluid dynamics simulations (smoke, fire, liquid) within the Blender environment for scientific visualization and graphics.

tools.name: FuSViz
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization tool for genomic structural variations
tools.detailed_description: FuSViz is a web-browser application designed to visualize, interpret, and prioritize genomic and transcriptomic structural variations (SVs) across multiple samples. It aids in the analysis of complex SV events.

tools.name: kmerSV
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and annotation tool for structural variants
tools.detailed_description: kmerSV is a tool for the visualization and annotation of structural variants (SVs). It leverages k-mer information to assist in the analysis of genomic structural variations.

tools.name: panz-SV-pipe
tools.one_line_profile: Structural variant calling and genotyping pipeline for pan-Zea
tools.detailed_description: panz-SV-pipe provides scripts for structural variant (SV) calling and genotyping, specifically tailored for pan-Zea (maize) genomic studies. It facilitates population-scale SV analysis.

tools.name: ximmer
tools.one_line_profile: CNV calling system for exome and targeted genomic sequencing
tools.detailed_description: Ximmer is a system designed for Copy Number Variation (CNV) calling on exome and targeted genomic sequencing data. It integrates multiple CNV calling methods and provides a framework for analysis.

tools.name: EvalSVcallers
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation tool for structural variation callers
tools.detailed_description: EvalSVcallers is a tool to evaluate the performance (precision and recall) of various structural variation (SV) callers. It is used for benchmarking and validating SV detection methods.

tools.name: TRsv
tools.one_line_profile: Detection of tandem repeat variations and SVs using long reads
tools.detailed_description: TRsv is a tool for detecting tandem repeat copy number variations (TR-CNVs) and structural variations (SVs) using long-read sequencing data. It addresses the challenge of analyzing repetitive regions in genomes.

tools.name: svviz
tools.one_line_profile: Read visualizer for structural variants
tools.detailed_description: svviz is a tool for visualizing high-throughput sequencing reads supporting structural variants. It realigns reads to the reference and variant alleles to provide clear visual evidence of SVs.

tools.name: mantaflow
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source framework for fluid simulation research
tools.detailed_description: mantaflow is an open-source framework targeted at fluid simulation research in Computer Graphics and Machine Learning. It provides a versatile environment for developing and testing fluid dynamics algorithms.

tools.name: cuteSV
tools.one_line_profile: Long-read based human genomic structural variation detection
tools.detailed_description: cuteSV is a fast and accurate structural variation (SV) detection tool designed for long-read sequencing data (PacBio/ONT). It uses a stepwise refinement strategy to identify various types of SVs.

tools.name: ngsParalog
tools.one_line_profile: Copy number variation detection using NGS data
tools.detailed_description: ngsParalog is a tool for detecting copy number variations (CNVs) using Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data. It is designed to handle read depth information to infer copy numbers.

tools.name: iCopyDAV
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated platform for Copy Number Variation detection, annotation, and visualization
tools.detailed_description: iCopyDAV is an integrated platform designed for the comprehensive analysis of Copy Number Variations (CNVs). It combines detection, annotation, and visualization functionalities into a single workflow.

tools.name: vortex-auv-simulator

tools.name: surpyvor

tools.name: CNVar

tools.name: TentacleSV

tools.name: CODEX2

tools.name: smartie-sv

tools.name: iCNV
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated copy number variation detection toolset
tools.detailed_description: iCNV is an integrated toolset for copy number variation detection. It combines data from multiple platforms or sequencing depths to improve the sensitivity and specificity of CNV calls.

tools.name: neural-admixture
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid population clustering tool using autoencoders
tools.detailed_description: A library for rapid population clustering and admixture analysis using autoencoders, providing a faster alternative to traditional methods like ADMIXTURE.

tools.name: plinkr

tools.detailed_description: A package that allows running PLINK commands and handling PLINK files directly from within the R environment.

tools.name: angsd-wrapper

tools.detailed_description: A set of wrapper utilities to facilitate the analysis of next-generation sequencing data using ANGSD, simplifying command-line interactions.

tools.name: KGD

tools.detailed_description: A tool for estimating kinship (genetic relatedness) specifically designed for Genotyping-by-Sequencing (GBS) data with depth adjustment.

tools.name: AlphaImpute2

tools.name: AlphaPlantImpute2

tools.detailed_description: A specialized version of AlphaImpute designed for genotype imputation in plant breeding populations.

tools.name: DPGT
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed population genetics analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A distributed tool for population genetics analysis enabling joint calling on millions of whole genome sequencing samples.

tools.name: PopGen.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Population Genetics library in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Julia package for population genetics analysis, providing functions for data manipulation and statistical inference.

tools.name: bpp-popgen
tools.one_line_profile: Bio++ Population Genetics Library
tools.detailed_description: The population genetics component of the Bio++ library, offering classes and functions for analyzing genetic diversity and structure.

tools.name: simuPOP

tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose forward-time simulation environment for population genetics, allowing modeling of complex evolutionary scenarios.

tools.name: bayesian-matrix-population-model

tools.name: impute-pipe

tools.name: SimRA

tools.detailed_description: A framework for simulating generic and complex evolutionary scenarios of multiple populations with subdivision and admixture using random-graphs algorithms.

tools.name: AdmixTools

tools.detailed_description: A software package for inferring admixture and population history from genetic data, including f-statistics and admixture graphs.

tools.name: graphtyper

tools.detailed_description: A tool for population-scale genotyping that utilizes pangenome graphs to improve variant calling accuracy.

tools.name: MARBLE

tools.detailed_description: A package for data-driven representation of non-linear dynamics over manifolds, applicable to neural systems and dynamical systems.

tools.name: strataG
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for population structure analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R toolkit for haploid sequence and multilocus genetic data summaries, and analyses of population structure.

tools.name: tidypopgen
tools.one_line_profile: Tidy grammar for population genetics in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a tidy grammar for population genetics, facilitating the manipulation and analysis of large SNP datasets.

tools.name: RelateAnything

tools.detailed_description: A model capable of taking an image as input and utilizing SAM (Segment Anything Model) to identify corresponding masks, applicable in computer vision tasks.

tools.name: VGpop

tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to perform population genetics analyses directly on Variation Graphs (pangenome graphs), enabling the study of genetic variation within a graph-based reference framework.

tools.name: haploMAGIC

tools.detailed_description: An R package for phasing, haplotype reconstruction, and crossover detection using SNP data, specifically optimized for multiparental populations in plant or animal breeding.

tools.name: MultLocMixMod
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-locus mixed-model approach for GWAS in structured populations
tools.detailed_description: An efficient multi-locus mixed-model implementation for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS), designed to handle population structure and improve power in detecting associations.

tools.detailed_description: A computational tool implementing the Multi-Locus Mixed-Model (MLMM) method for Genome-Wide Association Studies, correcting for population structure and confounding factors.

tools.name: mtmm
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-trait mixed-model for GWAS of correlated traits
tools.detailed_description: A mixed-model approach for Genome-Wide Association Studies that analyzes multiple correlated traits simultaneously in structured populations to increase detection power.

tools.name: STEAM

tools.detailed_description: An R package for estimating significance thresholds in admixture mapping studies, helping to correct for multiple testing in admixed populations.

tools.name: inPHAP

tools.detailed_description: A Java-based interactive viewer for phased haplotype data, allowing researchers to visualize and explore haplotype structures and phasing results.

tools.name: easyfinemap

tools.name: admix-kit

tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit providing utilities for processing and analyzing genetic data specifically from admixed populations, including local ancestry inference handling.

tools.name: hapcorrect

tools.name: ENIGMA Toolbox

tools.detailed_description: An open-source repository for accessing ENIGMA statistical maps, visualizing cortical/subcortical surface data, and relating neuroimaging findings to brain organization.

tools.name: IsoMaTrix

tools.detailed_description: A framework to visualize the isoclines of matrix games and quantify uncertainty in structured populations, often used in mathematical oncology and evolutionary game theory.

tools.name: SLiM
tools.one_line_profile: Genetically explicit forward simulation framework for population genetics
tools.detailed_description: A powerful and flexible forward simulation software package for population genetics and evolutionary biology, featuring a built-in scripting language (Eidos) and a graphical modeling environment.

tools.name: ADMIXTURE
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for maximum likelihood estimation of individual ancestries
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for maximum likelihood estimation of individual ancestries from multilocus SNP genotype datasets, widely used for population structure analysis.

tools.name: ADMIXTURE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia wrapper for the ADMIXTURE ancestry estimation program
tools.detailed_description: A Julia interface to the ADMIXTURE software, allowing users to run ancestry estimation analyses directly from the Julia programming environment.

tools.name: SnpArrays.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing efficient, compressed storage and manipulation utilities for Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP) data, optimized for large-scale genetic analyses.

tools.name: VarianceComponentModels.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for fitting and testing variance component models (linear mixed models), commonly used in statistical genetics for heritability estimation and association testing.

tools.name: POSYDON

tools.detailed_description: A next-generation population synthesis code for single and binary stars that incorporates full stellar structure and evolution modeling using MESA grids.

tools.name: ARG-Needle

tools.detailed_description: A library for representing, manipulating, and analyzing Ancestral Recombination Graphs (ARGs), which describe the joint genealogy of sampled DNA sequences along the genome.

tools.name: IBDGem

tools.detailed_description: A program designed for positive genetic identification and Identity-By-Descent (IBD) segment detection, specifically optimized for low-coverage sequencing data such as ancient DNA.

tools.name: FASconCAT-G

tools.name: TreeKnit.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that infers Ancestral Reassortment Graphs (ARGs) for segmented genomes, such as human influenza viruses, by knitting together phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: BEDMatrix
tools.one_line_profile: Matrix-like wrapper for PLINK .bed files
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides a matrix-like wrapper around PLINK binary (.bed) genotype files, allowing for memory-efficient access and manipulation of large genetic datasets.

tools.name: quetzal-CoaTL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ toolbox for geospatial population genetics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ template library for building spatially explicit, coalescent-based population genetics simulators, designed for modeling complex demographic and spatial scenarios.

tools.name: HaploNet
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network-based haplotype and population structure inference
tools.detailed_description: HaploNet is a deep learning framework designed for haplotype estimation and population structure inference, leveraging neural networks to model complex genetic relationships.

tools.name: hapla
tools.one_line_profile: Haplotype clustering tool for phased genotype data
tools.detailed_description: Hapla provides functionality for clustering haplotypes within phased genotype datasets, useful for analyzing local population structure.

tools.name: PyClone
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic model for inferring clonal population structure
tools.detailed_description: PyClone is a probabilistic model used to infer the clonal population structure of cancers from deep NGS sequencing data, analyzing single nucleotide variants (SNVs).

tools.name: PyClone-VI

tools.detailed_description: PyClone-VI is a faster implementation of the PyClone model using variational inference, designed to infer cancer clonal population structure from SNV data efficiently.

tools.name: PhasedDiploidGenomeAssemblyPipeline

tools.detailed_description: A pipeline that combines de-novo assembly and read-phasing techniques to construct reference-free diploid genome assemblies.

tools.name: DosageConvertor

tools.detailed_description: DosageConvertor is a C++ utility to convert dosage files in VCF format (generated by Minimac3/4) to formats compatible with MaCH or PLINK.

tools.name: Minimac3

tools.detailed_description: Minimac3 is a low-memory, computationally efficient implementation of genotype imputation algorithms, designed to handle large reference panels without loss of accuracy.

tools.name: PhaseGen
tools.one_line_profile: Inference on coalescent distributions under demographic scenarios
tools.detailed_description: PhaseGen performs computation and inference on exact solutions of coalescent distributions under diverse demographic scenarios, aiding in population genetic modeling.

tools.name: alstructure
tools.one_line_profile: R package for estimating admixture models of population structure
tools.detailed_description: alstructure implements the ALStructure algorithm to estimate admixture models of genetic population structure from genotype data.

tools.name: AdmixturePlotter
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization script for ADMIXTURE results
tools.detailed_description: An R script designed to generate plots for ADMIXTURE runs across multiple K values, facilitating the interpretation of population structure analysis.

tools.name: genome_structure_analysis

tools.detailed_description: Provides functions for calculating Void regions, A/B compartments, and spatial density enrichment in population and single-cell Hi-C data.

tools.detailed_description: A tool for assembling haplotypes from sequence reads, capable of handling data from various sequencing technologies to resolve phase information of variants.

tools.name: WhatsHap
tools.one_line_profile: Read-based phasing of genomic variants
tools.detailed_description: A software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing reads, also known as haplotype assembly. It works with long reads (PacBio, Nanopore) and supports various phasing modes.

tools.name: admix-simu
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of admixture between multiple populations
tools.detailed_description: A program to simulate admixture events involving multiple ancestral populations, useful for testing population genetics models and inference tools.

tools.name: PSVCP
tools.one_line_profile: Pan-genome construction and variation calling pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for constructing pan-genomes and calling population structure variations, facilitating the analysis of genetic diversity across populations.

tools.name: TrackVLA
tools.one_line_profile: Embodied visual tracking model for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A vision-language-action model implementation for embodied visual tracking in the wild, enabling robots to track objects based on visual and semantic cues.

tools.name: HapHiC
tools.one_line_profile: Allele-aware scaffolding tool using Hi-C data
tools.detailed_description: A fast, reference-independent scaffolding tool that uses Hi-C data to correct assembly errors and anchor contigs to chromosomes, with allele-aware capabilities for phasing.

tools.name: seqminer
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient query of genomic sequence data in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for efficiently querying and retrieving data from VCF, BCF, and BGEN files, facilitating the handling of large-scale genomic datasets in R environments.

tools.name: HIBAG
tools.one_line_profile: HLA genotype imputation with attribute bagging
tools.detailed_description: An R package for imputing HLA genotypes using SNP data, employing an attribute bagging method to handle the high polymorphism of the HLA region.

tools.name: ASC3
tools.one_line_profile: Variant prioritization tool for rare Mendelian diseases using multiple instance learning
tools.detailed_description: A variant prioritization tool that leverages multiple instance learning (MIL) to identify causal variants in rare Mendelian disease genomic testing.

tools.name: MIRACUM-Pipe
tools.one_line_profile: Whole exome sequencing pipeline with variant annotation and reporting
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) pipeline that includes advanced variant annotation features and automated PDF reporting capabilities.

tools.name: PIntron
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for gene-structure prediction via spliced alignment
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for gene-structure prediction based on spliced alignment of transcript sequences (ESTs and mRNAs) against a genomic sequence.

tools.name: stmp
tools.one_line_profile: Sequence to Medical Phenotypes pipeline for variant annotation and prioritization
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline featuring variant annotation, prioritization, pharmacogenomics, and tools for analyzing genomic trios (mother, father, child).

tools.name: simple_sv_annotation
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to simplify snpEff annotations for structural variants
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to simplify and streamline snpEff annotations for interesting structural variant cases.

tools.name: AlphScore
tools.one_line_profile: Pathogenicity prediction of missense variants using AlphaFold features
tools.detailed_description: A tool for improving pathogenicity prediction of missense variants by incorporating features derived from AlphaFold protein structures.

tools.name: AlphaMissenseCheck
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to check variant pathogenicity using AlphaMissense predictions
tools.detailed_description: A utility to analyze personal genomic data (e.g., 23andMe) against AlphaMissense pathogenicity predictions.

tools.name: Watershed
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic model for rare variant prioritization using RNA-seq
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the prioritization of functional rare genetic variants by integrating genomic annotations and RNA-seq data.

tools.name: VariantAnnotation
tools.one_line_profile: Bioconductor package for annotation of genetic variants
tools.detailed_description: A Bioconductor package for reading, writing, and annotating genetic variants in VCF format.

tools.name: ensemblVEP
tools.one_line_profile: R Interface to Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor
tools.detailed_description: A Bioconductor package providing an R interface to the Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) for querying variant effects.

tools.name: geneXtendeR
tools.one_line_profile: R package for functional annotation of ChIP-seq data
tools.detailed_description: An R/Bioconductor package designed for optimized functional annotation of ChIP-seq data, focusing on gene extensions.

tools.name: SURFY2
tools.one_line_profile: Classifier for predicting human transmembrane protein surface location
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning classifier to predict whether a human transmembrane protein is located at the cell surface or in intracellular membranes.

tools.name: FANTASIA
tools.one_line_profile: Functional annotation tool based on embedding space similarity
tools.detailed_description: A tool for Functional ANnoTAtion based on embedding space SImilArity, leveraging representation learning.

tools.name: introme
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to prioritise splice-altering variants for clinical interpretation
tools.detailed_description: Introme prioritises coding and noncoding splice-altering variants for clinical variant interpretation.

tools.name: vep_pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for variant annotation using VEP
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to automate variant annotation processes using the Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP).

tools.name: genmod
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to annotate genetic inheritance patterns in VCF files
tools.detailed_description: A tool to annotate models of genetic inheritance patterns in variant files (VCF), aiding in the identification of disease-causing variants.

tools.name: stranger
tools.one_line_profile: Annotates repeat expansion variants with pathologic implications
tools.detailed_description: A tool to annotate output files from ExpansionHunter and TRGT with the pathologic implications of the repeat expansions.

tools.name: GenomicInteractions
tools.one_line_profile: R package for handling and annotating genomic interaction data
tools.detailed_description: An R/Bioconductor package for handling genomic interaction data, annotating genomic features with interaction information, and producing summary statistics.

tools.name: snpEff (DBHi-BiC fork)

tools.detailed_description: A version of snpEff that includes HGVS annotations for nucleotide changes, predicting the functional effects of genomic variants.

tools.name: svpop

tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for variant annotation and merging, developed by the Eichler Lab.

tools.name: VEP_plugins

tools.detailed_description: Official repository for plugins that extend the functionality of the Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP).

tools.name: Ensembl VEP
tools.one_line_profile: Standard tool for predicting functional effects of genomic variants
tools.detailed_description: The Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) predicts the functional effects of genomic variants on genes, transcripts, and protein sequence, as well as regulatory regions.

tools.name: Envision
tools.one_line_profile: Predictor of protein variant molecular effect
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning predictor of protein variant molecular effect, trained using large-scale experimental mutagenesis data.

tools.name: ExPecto
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio prediction of expression effects of genomic variants
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework for predicting expression effects of human genome variants ab initio from sequence.

tools.name: genieBPC

tools.detailed_description: A tool for creating analytic cohorts from AACR Project GENIE BPC clinically annotated genomic data.

tools.name: GenomeView
tools.one_line_profile: Stand-alone genome browser and editor
tools.detailed_description: A stand-alone genome browser and editor that provides interactive visualization of sequences, annotations, alignments, and syntenic mappings.

tools.name: ClassifyCNV

tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool for the clinical annotation and classification of copy-number variants (CNVs) according to ACMG guidelines.

tools.name: table_annovar-nf

tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline designed to automate the annotation of genetic variants using ANNOVAR, facilitating reproducible and scalable bioinformatics workflows.

tools.name: SpliceAI

tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool that accurately predicts splice junctions from pre-mRNA sequence, aiding in the identification of non-coding variants that affect splicing.

tools.name: UTRannotator

tools.detailed_description: A VEP (Variant Effect Predictor) plugin designed to annotate high-impact variants in the 5' untranslated regions (UTR), specifically looking for uORF-creating variants.

tools.name: gnomAD_DB

tools.name: OpenCRAVAT
tools.one_line_profile: Modular variant annotation and prioritization tool
tools.detailed_description: A dynamic, modular tool for the annotation and prioritization of genomic variants, supporting a wide range of annotators and visualization options.

tools.name: SOSTAR

tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline for fine-mapping RNA isoform diversity using targeted long-read RNA sequencing, facilitating isoform annotation.

tools.name: SPiP
tools.one_line_profile: Splicing Prediction Pipeline for variant effect analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to predict the splicing effects of genetic variants, aiding in the interpretation of potential splice-altering mutations.

tools.name: Parsing-SnpEff

tools.detailed_description: A utility to parse SnpEff output into tabular formats, facilitating downstream analysis of annotated SNPs.

tools.name: DBFE

tools.detailed_description: A Python library for extracting features from distributions of genomic variants to facilitate machine learning classifier development.

tools.name: PyMissense

tools.detailed_description: A tool to create pathogenicity plots and modified PDB structures for custom proteins based on AlphaMissense predictions.

tools.name: FASSO

tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating functional annotations for maize genetics using sequence and structural orthology information.

tools.name: NeoPredPipe

tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for predicting neoantigens from single or multi-region VCF files, utilizing ANNOVAR for annotation and netMHCpan for binding prediction.

tools.name: SpliceR
tools.one_line_profile: Prediction of BE-splice sgRNAs for base editing
tools.detailed_description: A program designed to predict base editor-mediated splice sgRNAs for knockout experiments.

tools.name: EVE

tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model that uses evolutionary data to predict the clinical significance of genetic variants, enabling large-scale interpretation.

tools.name: GenNotes

tools.detailed_description: A platform and toolset for the public consensus annotation of genetic variants, facilitating community-driven variant interpretation.

tools.name: CLEAN-Contact

tools.detailed_description: A contrastive learning-enabled model for predicting enzyme functional annotations by incorporating structural inference.

tools.name: PharmCAT

tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to extract pharmacogenomic variants from VCF files and generate clinical reports based on CPIC guidelines.

tools.name: ProteinGym-Base

tools.detailed_description: Provides the data infrastructure and classes to combine assays, sequences, MSAs, and structures for variant effect prediction research.

tools.name: ProteinGym-Benchmark

tools.detailed_description: A collection of variant effect prediction models and pipelines to benchmark them against the ProteinGym datasets.

tools.name: RiboSplitter

tools.detailed_description: A tool for predicting protein translation consequences of RNA alternative splicing events.

tools.name: spyrmsd

tools.name: CAVA

tools.detailed_description: A fast and lightweight tool for the clinical annotation of genomic variants, designed to be compatible with standard VCF formats.

tools.name: NCBoost

tools.detailed_description: A machine learning classifier specifically designed to predict the pathogenicity of non-coding variants in Mendelian diseases.

tools.name: genofan

tools.name: eXtasy

tools.detailed_description: A tool for variant prioritization that uses genomic data fusion to rank variants based on their likelihood of being causal or pathogenic.

tools.name: Variant Agents

tools.detailed_description: A multi-agent system designed for genomic analysis, likely facilitating distributed or modular processing of genomic data.

tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to prioritize variants in Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) and Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) data by leveraging phenotype associations.

tools.detailed_description: A workflow designed for the annotation and ranking of genomic variants to facilitate variant discovery.

tools.name: IDP

tools.name: MyVariant.info

tools.name: spliceAI-pytorch

tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the SpliceAI model, used for predicting splice junctions and splicing effects of genomic variants.

tools.name: Varitas

tools.name: geneimpacts

tools.detailed_description: A library and tool to prioritize and normalize variant effect annotations from standard tools like VEP and SnpEff.

tools.name: vcfanno

tools.detailed_description: A fast and flexible tool for annotating VCF files with data from other VCFs, BED files, or tabixed files.

tools.name: SpliceAI-lookup

tools.detailed_description: A tool and web interface for looking up precomputed SpliceAI and Pangolin scores for genomic variants to assess splicing impact.

tools.name: bystro-vcf

tools.detailed_description: A high-performance VCF annotation tool designed for speed and scalability in genomic data processing.

tools.name: VAGrENT

tools.detailed_description: A toolset for comparing genomic variants to reference genome annotation to identify potential biological consequences.

tools.name: AutoCirc

tools.name: Jannovar

tools.name: nf-ncov-voc

tools.name: anor

tools.detailed_description: An R and Shiny-based system for annotation and visualization, likely designed for genomic or clinical data analysis.

tools.name: SUsPECT
